meanings.definition: A person who preaches on television, especially with the goal of soliciting donations.
meanings.sent1: Many people watch televangelists on TV to hear their messages.
meanings.sent2: Televangelists often ask viewers to donate money to support their ministries.
meanings.sent3: The televangelists on the screen seemed to be talking directly to me.
meanings.sent4: The televangelists' pleas for donations echoed through the airwaves.
meanings.sent5: The image of the televangelists stayed in my mind long after the program ended.

meanings.definition: The practice of preaching the Christian gospel on television.
meanings.sent1: The televangelists' messages reach a wide audience through TV broadcasts.
meanings.sent2: Televangelists use television as a platform to share their faith with viewers.
meanings.sent3: I never thought I'd see televangelists riding around in a TV-shaped car!
meanings.sent4: The impact of televangelists spreading the gospel on TV cannot be underestimated.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the TV studio illuminated the televangelists' faces as they preached.
